gg_na_dist The function gives a graphical representation of NA's distribution (monthly) during a selected period for one sensor.

Source: R/8_gg_na_dist.R
gg_na_dist.Rd

gg_na_dist The function gives a graphical representation of NA's distribution (monthly) during a selected period for one sensor.

Usage

gg_na_dist(
  data,
  sensor,
  start = NULL,
  end = NULL,
  hours = "ALL",
  list_weekday = "ALL",
  pub_holidays = "YES",
  holidays = "YES"
)

Arguments

data

Data.Frame. A data frame containing road traffic data.

sensor

Numeric. The sensor ID on which you want to see the representation.

start

Character. The start of the period in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".

end

Character. The end of the period in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".

hours

Vector. A vector containing hours on which you want to see the representation, e.g., c("05h", "18h").

list_weekday

Vector. A vector containing weekdays in French, e.g., c("Monday", "Sunday").

pub_holidays

Character. "YES" if you want to see results with public holidays included; "NO" if you want to exclude them from the representation; "ONLY" if you only want to see them in the result.

holidays

Character. "YES" if you want to see results including holidays; "NO" if you want to exclude them from the representation; "ONLY" if you only want to see them in the result.

Value

A ggplot graph.
